text: Tlotliso Leotlela (born May 12, 1998) is a South African sprinter. He competed at the 2016 Summer Olympics in the men's 200 metres race; his time of 20.59 seconds in the heats did not qualify him for the semifinals. ==International competitions== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |rowspan=5|2015 |rowspan=3|African Youth Championships |rowspan=3|Reduit, Mauritius |bgcolor=gold|1st |100 m |10.38 (w) |- |bgcolor=gold|1st |200 m |20.84 |- |bgcolor=gold|1st |Medley relay |1:53.60 |- |rowspan=2|Commonwealth Youth Games |rowspan=2|Apia, Samoa |bgcolor=gold|1st |100 m |10.20 |- |bgcolor=gold|1st |200 m |20.56 (w) |- |rowspan=5|2016 |rowspan=2|African Championships |rowspan=2|Durban, South Africa |4th |100 m |10.24 |- |bgcolor=gold|1st |4 × 100 m relay |38.84 |- |rowspan=2|World U20 Championships |rowspan=2|Bydgoszcz, Poland |4th |100 m |10.28 |- |bgcolor=silver|2nd |200 m |20.59 |- |Olympic Games |Rio de Janeiro, Brazil |42nd (h) |200 m |20.59 |} == Personal bests == {| class="wikitable" |+ !Event !Time (seconds) !Venue !Date |- |100 metres |10.12 |Pretoria, South Africa |18 March 2017 |- |200 metres |20.20 |Potchefstroom, South Africa |22 April 2017 |- |4x100 metres relay |38.47 |Germiston, South Africa |22 March 2017 |} •All information taken from IAAF profile ==References== Category:1998 births Category:Living people Category:South African male sprinters Category:Olympic athletes of South Africa Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2016 Summer Olympics
title: Tlotliso Leotlela
